channel.title: Making the owner log in?
channel.description: Hello Moparscape,As you might know.Rs w00dcut got hacked so this is my Temp. account. I need to know the answer for the following questions,I haven't done it in ages. How do I make it say"The owner and coder Rs w00dcut or something has logged in" ~Thanks, Rs w00dcut

item.title: Making the owner log in?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Lol… Search for:
sendMessage(playerName + " has just

Replace that line with;
if(playerRights == 3) {
sendMessage(“Owner " + playerName + " has just logged in”);
} else {
sendMessage(playerName + " has just logged in.");
}

Read full topic

item.title: Making the owner log in?
item.dc:creator: @_J_O_H_N [-J O H N-]
item.description:
@_J_O_H_N wrote:

Get project Destiny source, look it up and you’ll find it easy. Although I have mine set when my staff logs in it’ll say “Staff member [Players name] has logged in”

Read full topic

item.title: Making the owner log in?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:4, topic:160734”]Don’t change it. Under it just put

else
if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("rs w00dcut"))
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "The owner, rs w00dcut, has just logged in!";
}

The one above would give you errors. You can’t compare Strings with ==. That would be like saying

if("moparscape" > "sex") { System.out.println("OMGZ0RZ YOUS GUN GET ERRERS1!!1"); }

Although it is true. :D[/quote]
I’m sorry, you can compare Strings with ==.

Read full topic

item.title: Making the owner log in?
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

GoldenScape:

Yes,But I need to know where to add it.

You know where this is?:

if(playerRights == 0 && register == 0) { sendMessage("Type ::commands, ::howto, ::menus"); sendMessage("Type ::updates for new updates on the server!"); sendMessage("Black screen? Type ::fish"); } if(playerRights == 1 && register == 0) { sendMessage("Welcome back to P00nageScape, "+playerName); sendMessage("::commands2"); sendMessage("Type ::updates for new updates on the server!"); } ETC

Put It Under it, thats it.

woofdawg23:

dude I even know this and I’m in the stages of becomnig agood coder… I know why you don’t know this because you have been leeching sources all these years of coding like project 69 is totally funscap3…

Doesn’t involve ‘coding ablities’. Just common sense, when the player logs in, what happens? They get a welcome mesage, Omg what did i just say? Exactly.

Read full topic

item.title: Making the owner log in?
item.dc:creator: @kniveslives kniveslives
item.description:
@kniveslives wrote:

This is mine;

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Kniveslives”)) {
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “[Owner]”+playerName+" has logged in! There are now “+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players.”;
}

Just change the “Kniveslives” part to whatever, and then change the “[Owner]” to whatever you wanted it to say “Owner and Coder” I guess you would put it as.

Read full topic

item.title: Making the owner log in?
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Im sorry but wow lol.

Ok you know where your welcome message is? After playRights whatever and the last bracket of that specific mesage, Put the code in there.

For Example:

if (server.adminControl.ServerAdmin(playerName)) { sendMessage("Admin Recognized!"); sendMessage("::commands3"); sendMessage("Type ::updates for new updates on the server!"); }*
Add After Last Bracket(* Is Bracket, Press Enter):

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("URNAMEHERE")) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "P00nageScape Co-Owner WhyMustIOwn has logged on!"; }

Read full topic

item.title: Making the owner log in?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Find where your current login message is, then change it to:

if((playerName == "rs w00dcut") {
playerHandler.messageToAll = "The owner and coder rs w00dcut has logged in.";
}
else {
playerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + " has logged in.";
}

Try that, maybe?

Read full topic
